title: Elon's erratic entry leaves Twitter in chaos as he vows to free suspended users from 'Twitter jail'
Hear details from Paul Pelosi's coded 911 call that led to his rescue
description: CNN's John Miller shares details from the 911 call made by Paul Pelosi, husband to Nancy Pelosi, when an intruder broke into the couple's San Francisco home. According to a source, the intruder had been looking for the House Speaker when he attacked Paul with a hammer.

title: Evolutionary mystery of harmonious flower meadow may be solved
description: Amid the heights of a mountain range in southwestern China, thousands of different species of rhododendrons mysteriously live together in harmony, without fighting as they do in other areas for the pollinators that are crucial to their continued survival.

title: Can Trump resist siren song of Twitter?
description: Elon Musk now owns Twitter. Which, among other things, means that the permanent ban of former President Donald Trump from the social media site could soon end.

title: Alleged Paul Pelosi attacker posted multiple conspiracy theories
description: The man who allegedly attacked House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's husband early Friday posted memes and conspiracy theories on Facebook about Covid vaccines, the 2020 election and the January 6, 2021 attack on the Capitol, and an acquaintance told CNN that he seemed "out of touch with reality."

title: Unknown number of victims after multiple shots fired in Pittsburgh, officials say
description: Multiple shots were fired in Pittsburgh on Friday and there is an unknown number of victims at this time, said Pittsburgh Public Safety officials.

title: Jerry Lee Lewis, rock 'n' roll pioneer who sang 'Great Balls of Fire,' dies at 87
description: Jerry Lee Lewis, the piano-pounding, foot-stomping singer who electrified early rock 'n' roll with hits like "Great Balls of Fire" and "Whole Lotta Shakin' Goin' On" before marital scandal derailed his career, has died, according to a statement from his representative, Zach Farnum. He was 87.

title: The intruder shouted 'where is Nancy?' before the attack, according to a source
Watch late night reacts to Musk's sink pun that cost him $44 billion
description: Musk carried a sink into Twitter's headquarters as his purchase of the company was "sinking in." Late night hosts enjoyed mocking the moment, even adding their own puns to the situation.

title: GOP candidate said Dems 'still mad' the North won the Civil War
description: Tudor Dixon, the Republican gubernatorial nominee in Michigan, invoked a conspiracy that the Covid-19 pandemic and protests in the summer of 2020 after the killing of George Floyd were part of a decades-long plan by the Democratic Party to "topple" the United States as retaliation for losing the US Civil War, adding that the party wanted to enslave people "again."

title: CNN talks to 8-year-old climber from the side of El Capitan
description: CNN talks to eight-year-old climber Sam Baker, along with his dad Joe Baker, as they are on the side of El Capitan in Yosemite National Park in their journey to reach the summit and make the eight-year-old the youngest person to make the climb.

title: Assailant who attacked Paul Pelosi was searching for the Speaker, source says
description: The assailant who attacked Paul Pelosi was searching for Speaker of the House Nancy Pelosi, according to a source briefed on the attack.

title: Body found at Frankfurt airport in plane undercarriage on inbound flight from Tehran
description: A body was found in the undercarriage of a Lutfhansa plane that arrived at Frankfurt airport from Tehran on Thursday, according to German police and Lufthansa.

title: Cillizza: One key number that could spell doom for Democrats in the midterms
description: President Joe Biden's poll numbers have fallen steadily in the past couple months. In today's episode of The Point, CNN's Chris Cillizza breaks down the consequences that could have for Democrats in the midterms.

title: Will Prince Harry's book spare the royal family embarrassment?
description: There has been no official statement from either of the palaces about Prince Harry's upcoming memoir and we don't expect one, but we can safely assume it's the source of plenty of chatter behind palace walls -- and a certain degree of dread about its contents.

title: What took Adidas, Gap and other businesses so long to dump Kanye West?
description: Earlier this week Adidas ended its partnership with rapper and fashion designer Ye (who previously went by Kanye West). Its decision came around the same time that a flurry of other companies also cut ties with the artist — but weeks after Ye began making offensive remarks.

title: Ghostly figures emerge from Pillars of Creation in new Webb telescope image
description: The James Webb Space Telescope has glimpsed the dark side of the usually ethereal Pillars of Creation, located 6,500 light-years away in the Eagle Nebula.

title: US orders families of embassy employees to depart Nigeria due to heightened risk of terrorism
description: The State Department has ordered non-emergency US embassy employees and their family members in Abuja, Nigeria to leave the country "due to the heightened risk of terrorist attacks there."

title: Rishi Sunak's wealth and right-wing politics mean he is far from representative, British Asians say
description: Orange and pink fireworks colored the skies over south London on Monday, as members of the local South Asian community celebrated Diwali.

title: Pro-Russian officials remove remains of 18th century commander Potemkin from Ukrainian cathedral
description: Pro-Russian officials say they have removed the bones of famed 18th century Russian commander Grigory Potemkin from the occupied Ukrainian city of Kherson.

title: Katy Perry explains her eye twitch moment as a 'party trick'
description: Katy Perry had been performing during her "Play Las Vegas" residency on Sunday evening, when her eye began to visibly twitch, much like a doll. She tried to fix it as her right eye remained open.

title: Niall Horan is dropping new music and heading out on tour
description: Niall Horan is going to have a busy 2023.

title: Tom Brady and Gisele Bündchen to file for divorce
description: Tom Brady and Gisele Bündchen, who married in 2009, plan to file for divorce on Friday, a source with direct knowledge told CNN.

title: Must-watch videos of the week
Paul Pelosi, husband of House Speaker Nancy Pelosi, attacked at home
description: Paul Pelosi, the husband of House Speaker Nancy Pelosi, was attacked at the couple's home in San Francisco early Friday morning, the Democratic speaker's office said in a statement. He is expected to make a full recovery.

title: 'The White Lotus' relocates to Sicily and delivers another five-star experience
description: "The White Lotus" hasn't lost any of its intoxicating allure, shifting its mix of rich-people problems and staff struggles to a new island (Sicily), with Jennifer Coolidge as the one holdover from the Emmy-winning original. It's an impressive exercise in reloading by writer-director Mike White, who based on this encore should have plenty of frequent-flyer miles in his future if he chooses.

title: Soccer star Pablo Mari has surgery to reconstruct muscles in his back after being stabbed during attack in Italy
description: Arsenal defender Pablo Mari, who is currently on loan at Italian club AC Monza, says he was "lucky" after being injured during a stabbing attack in Italy on Thursday.

title: Rihanna's 'Lift Me Up' sets emotional 'Wakanda Forever' tone
description: Rihanna's first solo new music in six years is out and tugging at heartstrings.

title: Hundreds of thousands of Ukrainians left without power, utility CEO says
Five years ago, a circus singer called to say James Brown was murdered
description: One Tuesday afternoon in 2017, the phone rang at my desk in CNN Center. On the line was a woman who told me, "James Brown did not die the way they said he died. And I have proof of it." The caller's name was Jacque Hollander. She was a singer for the Carson & Barnes Circus.

title: ExxonMobil posts another record profit as oil prices remain high
description: ExxonMobil's profit set a record for the second straight quarter as oil and gas prices remained high. No. 2 US oil company Chevron also posted much-better-than-expected results.

title: Colossal Andy Warhol painting of a car crash could sell for over $80 million
description: Andy Warhol may be best known for his pop art iconography of Marilyn Monroe, Chairman Mao and Campbell's soup cans, but next month, a "haunting" silkscreen print of a mangled car crash will be up for sale at Sotheby's in New York. Going under the hammer on November 16 during the auction house's marquee week, It is expected to sell for upwards of $80 million, according to a press statement.

title: Biden and Harris set to make rare joint campaign appearance for Pennsylvania Democrats
description: President Joe Biden and Vice President Kamala Harris will make a rare joint appearance on the campaign trail in Philadelphia Friday evening as they seek to boost Pennsylvania Democrats in the closing stretch of the election.

title: The Italian region where tomato is off the menu
description: Ah Italy, the land of pizza, pasta and plenty of tomato sauce. At least, that's the impression many visitors have when planning a trip to the Bel Paese. But if they're planning to visit popular tourist sites like Cinque Terre or Portofino, they might be in for a shock -- because the traditional food of Liguria, the northwest coastal region where both are located, is far from what outsiders might call "Italian."

title: 'Mattress Mack': Houston Astros superfan has wagered $10 million to win $75 million if team wins World Series
description: The Houston Astros are strong favorites to win the World Series, which starts Friday, and one of the team's most famous fans is going all in on oddsmakers' predicted outcome for the "Fall Classic."

title: Elon Musk now owns Twitter. Here's what he could change
description:
• Musk fires Twitter's top executives 
• Open letter: Musk tells advertisers he doesn't want Twitter to become 'free-for-all hellscape'

title: Schumer caught on hot mic giving Biden bad midterm news
description: Senate majority leader Chuck Schumer (D-NY) told President Joe Biden that the Democrats were losing ground in the Georgia Senate race.

title: With his own midterm 'shellacking' in mind, Obama returns to campaign trail to boost Democrats
description: Midterm elections were never Barack Obama's strong suit.

title: The Fed is killing the housing market
description: The US economy grew by a 2.6% adjusted annual rate in the third-quarter, bouncing back from two negative quarters and beating analyst expectations.

title: The Supreme Court's big decision on Roe set chaos in motion
description: More than four months after the Supreme Court's decision in Dobbs v. Jackson Women's Health overturned Roe v. Wade, undoing nearly five decades of federally-guaranteed legal abortion access, Americans across the country are still wrestling with the consequences of the decision.

title: Russia has sent up to 1,000 troops to defend occupied Kherson, Ukraine says
description: • Putin: World faces 'most dangerous decade' since end of WWII

title: Taking your blood pressure meds may reduce risk of dementia
description: Knowing you have higher than normal blood pressure — and taking medications daily to treat it — may be one key to avoiding dementia in later life, a new study found.

title: Lucianne Goldberg, key figure in Clinton impeachment, dies at 87
description: Lucianne Goldberg, the literary agent who suggested to Linda Tripp that she record her phone calls with Monica Lewinsky talking about her relationship with then-President Bill Clinton, has died at the age of 87.

title: Tom Brady becomes most sacked quarterback in NFL history as Tampa Bay Buccaneers suffer third straight defeat
description: Tom Brady is used to setting new records but he wouldn't have wanted this one.

title: How to tell if the GOP is heading for a landslide in the House
description: The conditions are ripe for Republicans to win the US House of Representatives next month. So while Senate control is still up for grabs, the discussion on the House side has shifted to just how large a possible new GOP majority could be.

title: Gordan Ramsay videos and TikTok: How Olympian Dennis Ombach learned to live with bipolar
description: In sport there is nothing more revered than scoring the winning points in the last minute, snatching victory from the jaws of defeat. All of sports' greatest matches have that moment which stick in fans' forever. But not for Kenya rugby's Dennis Ombachi.

title: Heir to cricket and rugby excellence, New Zealand golfer Ryan Fox blazes his own trail
description: Pursuing a career in professional sports is hard. Following in your family's footsteps is hard.

title: Kotchakorn Voraakhom: The architect helping sinking cities fight flooding
description: When floods devastated Bangkok more than a decade ago, Thai landscape architect Kotchakorn Voraakhom became determined to help her sinking hometown fight this deadly climate threat.

title: Hundreds of thousands of Ukrainians left without power, utility CEO says
World Series 2022: Philadelphia Phillies and Houston Astros face off for place in MLB history
description: The 2022 World Series is a classic case of overwhelming favorite against plucky underdog.

title: Video shows frightening moment before damaged plane makes emergency landing
description: A LATAM Airlines plane was damaged traveling from Santiago, Chile, to Asunción, Paraguay. The vessel had to make an emergency landing after experiencing "severe weather conditions during its flight path," the airline said in a statement. CNN's Kim Brunhuber reports.

title: Stunning images from African Wildlife Foundation's photography award are inspiring conservation
description: An image of a pensive mountain gorilla with blazing orange eyes claimed the top prize in the 2022 Benjamin Mkapa African Wildlife Photography Awards.

title: Retirement? 'We're not there yet' says Zlatan Ibrahimović
description: He turned 41 earlier this month and due to a serious knee injury won't play until next year, but the last thing on Zlatan Ibrahimović's mind right now is retirement.

title: What happened to China's former leader Hu Jintao?
description: It is a moment that for many observers has come to define strongman leader Xi Jinping's tightening grip on China: his visibly frail predecessor, Hu Jintao, being escorted out of a key Communist Party meeting during a five-yearly leadership reshuffle -- apparently at Xi's behest.

title: St. Louis school shooter was flagged in FBI background check but was still able to legally purchase a gun, police say
description: The gunman who killed two people and wounded several others in a school shooting in St. Louis, Missouri, on Monday was flagged by an FBI background check but was still able to purchase the AR-15-style rifle he used in the attack from a private seller, police said.

title: Ukrainian forces are inching closer to Russian-controlled territory. See what the front line is like
description: Russian state media report the situation in the Kherson region of Ukraine is stabilizing, with less frequent artillery fire and no counterattacks from Ukrainian forces. Meanwhile, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky says the Russians will be besieged if they stay in the Kherson region. CNN's Frederik Pleitgen visits the front line to get a first-hand look.

title: Food is on the ballot for millions of poor Brazilians ahead of presidential run-off vote
description: In a flimsy wooden structure in a small favela on the outer edges of São Paulo, a kitchen, bed, and television occupy the same room.

title: Biden moves to shore up support in blue states in an election that appears to be slipping away
description: Joe Biden's midterm pitch is increasingly stark and alarmist as he grapples for momentum in an election seemingly slipping away from Democrats that could land him with a Congress inflicting two years of misery on his White House.

title: North Korea fires ballistic missile off east coast, South Korea says
description: North Korea fired at least one ballistic missile into waters off the east coast of the Korean Peninsula on Friday, according to South Korean officials.

title: Xi's 'action men' now lead China's military. Here's what that means for Taiwan
description: Star roles for "action men" in China's new military leadership may hint at an increased threat of war with Taiwan, though analysts suggest Xi Jinping's stated preference for a peaceful takeover of the island should be taken at face value -- at least for now.

title: Musk has completed his deal to buy Twitter and has fired multiple top executives, sources familiar with the deal tell CNN
description: Elon Musk has completed his deal to buy Twitter, a source familiar with the deal told CNN Thursday.

title: Michael Imperioli reveals embarrassing moment while filming 'The Sopranos'
description: Michael Imperioli, who stars in the new season of HBOMax's "The White Lotus," talks to CNN's Chris Wallce about his first day on the job alongside James Gandolfini in "The Sopranos," and how he interpreted the ending of the hit series.

title: In pictures: Elon Musk, the world's richest man
description: Elon Musk built a commercial rocket company from scratch and upended the auto industry as a high-profile evangelist for electric cars.

title: Elon Musk has taken control of Twitter and fired its top executives
Russian college student spray painted "Putin = war." Hear what he says happened next
description: Russian college student Mikhail Sukhoruchkin tells CNN's Anderson Cooper he was beaten by police and fled to Poland after spray painting "Putin = war" on a wall.

title: A luxurious train journey to the world's largest Buddhist temple
description: Seated inside a plush train carriage fitted with traditional Javanese batik tapestries, paintings and books, travelers on board Indonesia's newest luxury train are surely in agreement that the journey is as important as the destination.

title: Hear what Janet Yellen thinks of the US economy right now
description: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said in an exclusive interview with CNN said she did not see signs of a recession in the near term as the US economy rebounded from six months of contraction.
